title: A tale of two Vodafones – five private 5G takeaways (half-time at UPTIME)
summary: From global private-5G deployments at Vodafone Business to national spectrum policy gridlock at Vodafone Idea, plus the looming exit of Nokia, the private 5G market looks both more mature and more fragile than it ever has. The numbers are improving, if not fast enough; the messaging and mindset still need work. Just to continue the […]

title: IoT turns hot as operators like Vodafone integrate satellite
summary: Vodafone says the advent of low-Earth-orbit (LEO) is propelling satellite connectivity for IoT services.

title: Amdocs says aOS can help telcos take control of their AI roadmap
summary: Amdocs is pitching an “open by design” framework that lets telcos build AI agents on their own terms without vendor lock-in, exec Ronen David told Fierce.

title: América Móvil keeps investing in Chile after Telefónica sale
summary: América Móvil had initially explored a joint bid with Entel for Telefónica’s Chilean business but ultimately decided not to proceed In sum – what to know: Chile remains strategic despite challenges – CEO Daniel Hajj described the market as “difficult,” but said the company continues investing to gain revenue, market share and operational synergies. title: Orange Business, Cisco unveil new quantum security services
summary: Orange Business has commercially launched global post-quantum cryptography (PQC) services that run on Cisco’s routing tech.

title: Wall Street 'SaaS-Pocalypse' portends profound telco software upheaval
summary: A surprise Wall Street selloff sparked by Anthropic’s new Claude Legal AI foreshadows a broader upheaval for telco software, as agentic AI threatens legacy OSS/BSS platforms, vendor lock‑in and the jobs built around them.

title: Optimum: Hyperscalers drove 35% Q4 growth in Lightpath’s fiber business
summary: Lightpath, Optimum’s enterprise fiber business, saw quarterly revenue jump 35% year over year due to rising hyperscaler demand, said CFO Marc Sirota.

title: T-Mobile is trying to make voice calling cool again with new AI translation service
summary: T-Mobile today unveiled a language translation service that relies on real-time agentic AI built directly into its wireless network. It's expected to launch in beta this spring.

title: Cone of light: Notre Dame team develops a new terahertz antenna for 6G
summary: Using photonics, a Notre Dame team has developed a new style of antenna for terahertz 6G communications.

title: The Five Nine: What the future looks like for private wireless networks
summary: A major vendor shifting focus, a spectrum tug of war and the unavoidable rise of AI have people wondering: what’s next for private wireless. We took the question to Celona CEO Rajeev Shah and SNS Telecom's Asad Khan.

title: A new era of humanoid robots
summary: Synopsys ramps up work around physical AI to help build adaptive machines capable of sensing and interacting with physical environments The latest addition to AI’s book of lingo, physical AI, is already entering mainstream vocabulary.  You may have heard Nvidia drumming it the loudest, but now long-time partner Synopsys is carrying the torch forward.  Ahead […]

title: AI in intent-based networking (IBN)
summary: Imagine a network engineer typing “prioritize video traffic in downtown Seattle” into a console and having the system automatically translate that single sentence into thousands of command-line configuration changes across routers, switches, and firewalls. No memorizing vendor-specific syntax or manually SSH-ing into dozens of devices. That’s the pitch behind Intent-Based Networking (IBN) — a management paradigm where […]

title: Virgin Media O2 switches on 5G SA in Manchester
summary: Virgin Media O2 said the Manchester deployment is part of a wider national plan to extend SA 5G to cities, towns, and transport routes In sum – what to know: 5G SA reaches Manchester region – O2 has launched 5G SA in Manchester and nearby towns, bringing the technology to more than 500 locations across […]

title: Rakuten Mobile posts first EBITDA profit
summary: In a conference call with investors, Rakuten Group’s chairman Mickey Mikitani said that Rakuten Mobile plans to invest over JPY200 million in fiscal 2026 In sum – what to know: First full-year EBITDA profit – Rakuten Mobile posted JPY12.9 billion in EBITDA, improving JPY66.7 billion year-on-year. Subscriber base tops 10 million – Total subscriptions reached […]

title: Webinar: Networks at the frontline – How 6G, ISAC and NTNs will redefine defense technologies
summary: As 6G takes shape, integrated sensing and communications (ISAC) and non-terrestrial networks (NTNs) are being developed to create a new class of defense-ready connectivity that fuses intelligence, awareness and resilience. This RCR Wireless News’ webinar explores how these next-generation capabilities will transform command-and-control, enhance situational sensing and extend secure communications into contested and remote environments. title: Why AI is a systems problem, not a software one
summary: AI is exposing infrastructure limits across telecom and utilities, forcing carriers to rethink how intelligence is built and delivered.

title: What on earth is Giga-MIMO?
summary: Massive MIMO meets AI to make Giga-MIMO in a pre-6G world.

title: T-Mobile's new reporting metric policy turns heads
summary: T-Mobile's no longer going to report postpaid phone net additions on a quarterly basis, a move that's not getting a lot of love.

title: The human-in-the-loop solution

title: What is AI-RRM in Wi-Fi 7?
summary: AI-RRM enables Wi-Fi 7 networks to deliver high performance in real-world deployments As Wi-Fi 7 deployments accelerate, the industry is also beginning to see how artificial intelligence can play a practical role in next-generation wireless performance. title: FCC gives Amazon Leo the greenlight to launch more satellites
summary: With the FCC’s permission to launch 4,500 more satellites, Amazon Leo will potentially have a low-Earth-orbit (LEO) constellation of more than 7,700 satellites.

title: T-Mobile talks free chicken, ‘best value’ and customer loyalty
summary: T-Mobile added 962,000 new postpaid phone customers in Q4 2025, but in the future, it’s not going to report phone net adds – it shifting to account-based metrics.

title: Boldyn appoints U.S. leader as new global CEO
summary: Boldyn replaces CEO Leprince with U.S. leader Karmis.

title: Commerce Secretary Lutnick blasts SpaceX’s proposed BEAD rider
summary: The modified BEAD subgrantee agreement SpaceX sent to states is “rejected” and violates program rules, Lutnick confirmed.

title: Opinion: A reality check on AI latency: The 30 ms milestone
summary: Where do U.S. providers stand in relation to the 30 ms latency milestone? Ookla's latest data can provide some insights.

title: Sovereign cloud surges as global tensions heat up - Gartner
summary: Sovereign cloud and AI sovereignty are accelerating worldwide as enterprises shift workloads to local providers, governments seek digital independence and telcos outside the U.S. seize new revenue opportunities.

title: Opinion: We've given huge hunks of BEAD to satellite. Now what?
summary: Telecom industry consultant Doug Dawson said, “Starlink is a black box. I don’t think the BEAD money is very important to them in the big scheme of things.”

title: Q&A: Why AI speed - not scale - will define next global digital economy
summary: Inference latency, not training scale, is becoming the limiting factor for AI’s next phase. Check out our interview with Andrew Feldman, CEO, Cerebras, to find out why.

title: Tarana stays bullish on BEAD despite ‘underperforming’ fixed wireless access results
summary: Fixed wireless access only won 11% of BEAD locations, but Tarana’s Carl Guardino said the company’s looking forward rather than dwelling on results.

summary: Trump Mobile executives showed a near-final version of the T1 phone to The Verge.

summary: As BEAD funding moves closer to deployment, we're keeping track of every state and territory's progress toward NTIA approval and NIST authorization.

title: HVAC giant Trane buys LiquidStack to bolster AI data center cooling portfolio
summary: Its decision to outright acquire LiquidStack comes as consolidation starts to heat up in the rapidly growing data center cooling market.

title: Opinion: The size of the 6G wave
summary: The mobile market is entering the commodity phase, where investment in new infrastructure will be limited, and more attention will be paid to optimization of the existing infrastructure.

title: Career moves — BT reveals succession plan
summary: Welcome to Career Moves, Fierce's weekly rundown of recent hirings, firings and retirings across the tech and telecom sectors.
